metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0221 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The dtls1_get_message_fragment function in d1_both.c in OpenSSL before 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (recursion and client crash) via a DTLS hello message in an invalid DTLS handshake.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.2
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

libssl0.9.8 - 0.9.8o-7ubuntu3.2.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.2').
